clinical_study.brief_title: A Predictive Score for the Ischemic Etiology of a Transient Diplopia (VASCO-DIP)
clinical_study.official_title: Development and Validation of a Predictive Score for the Ischemic Etiology of a Transient Diplopia

brief_summary.textblock:
The transient diplopias (TD) is defined by a short diplopia. Their etiology may be ophthalmological, neurological non-ischemic or of ischemic origin.
The difficulty is to recognize an ischemic mechanism which imposes emergency cares.
A clinical score could help the clinician to recognize the etiology of the TD .

primary_outcome.measure: Etiology, ischemic or not, of the initial transient diplopia
primary_outcome.description: Questionnaire about the symptoms and about the vascular risk factors, cerebral MRI, MRI angiography of the supra-aortic trunks, ECG, Holter, transthoracic echocardiography, blood count, erythrocytes sedimentation rate, C reactive protein, visual field, optical coherence tomography, retinography and a new evaluation after 3 months.
